alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 5:07AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Series of storms will impact the area into next week... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Lower Yukon Delta this morning spreading snow to the area through the day. Snowfall with this system will spread north and east into Saturday with 3 to 8 inches of snowfall south of the Bering Strait by Saturday morning, with 1 to 4 inches of accumulation north of the Bering Strait through Saturday. A second, much stronger storm, will move into the Western Bering Sea on Saturday. This system will spread strong winds and heavy snow over the West Coast Saturday night into Sunday morning, with heavy snowfall moving into the Western Interior on Sunday. Up to a foot of snow is possible Saturday night into Monday across the Northwest Arctic as well as over portions of the Seward Peninsula. As this system moves over the area, temperatures will warm resulting in a chance of mixed or freezing precipitation south of the Bering Strait Saturday night through Sunday. This second storm will bring southwest gales blowing across the Bering Sea Saturday into Monday, and across the Chukchi Sea Sunday into Monday. There is potential for coastal flooding similar to the last system that brought elevated water levels to areas south of the Bering Strait. Expect water to push up on top of the ice along the coastline and in bays. Stay tuned to www.weather.gov/fairbanks for the latest forecast updates.
